ud1.9:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Gāyā on Gāyā Head.
ud1.9:1.3: Now at that time—during the cold days of snowfall in the dead of winter—many dreadlocked ascetics plunged in and out of the Gayā river. Plunging and showering, they served the sacred flame, thinking:
ud1.9:2.1: The Buddha saw them plunging in and out.
ud1.9:3.1: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
